channel.title: So, how do I use my HelloWorldApp on a webpage?
channel.description:
Okay, JAVA is unlike the languages I know, since it's all program - related and requires compiling and such. I went through the tutorial of the "Hello World" thing, it compiled right, but now how do I make a java applet say "Hello World" on a web page with what I did?
[code] class HelloWorldApp { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello World!"); } } [/code]
[code] <applet width="512" height="344" code="HelloWorldApp.class"></applet> [/code]
[code] load: HelloWorldApp.class is not public or has no public constructor. java.lang.IllegalAccessException: Class sun.applet.AppletPanel can not access a member of class HelloWorldApp with modifiers "" at sun.reflect.Reflection.ensureMemberAccess(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin.AppletViewer.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.runLoader(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
I did a lil bit of research to see if anyone else had my problem on the Java website for beginners, and some guy said something about "extends java.applet.Applet ".
Can anybody give me a copy and pasteable of an applet saying hello world that will properly compile so this doesn't become the biggest battle on getting started with Java Applets?
Thanks.

item.title: So, how do I use my HelloWorldApp on a webpage?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

noooooo I got a warning.

K. Only classes extending “Applet” may be put into webpages. I suggest that you first learn java before attempting somethign advanced. In other words, [quote=“1337h4x, post:3, topic:93242”]lolololoolololol

l2java
[center] How about you help? :P[/center][/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: So, how do I use my HelloWorldApp on a webpage?

item.title: So, how do I use my HelloWorldApp on a webpage?
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“The Producer, post:4, topic:93242”]I want to point out that the header:

class HelloWorldApp

needs to start out as:

public class HelloWorldApp

No, it doesn’t. l2modifier: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/javaOO/accesscontrol.html

Read full topic

item.title: So, how do I use my HelloWorldApp on a webpage?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

i suggest you learn more java, doing a hello world application is a lot easier than doing a hello world applet
theres a big gap between, first learn about variables, methods, object and then Applet
however, here is a simple hello world applet

import java.applet.*;
import java.awt.*;

public class HelloWorldApplet extends Applet {

            public void paint(Graphics g) {
                      g.setColor(Color.BLACK);
                      g.drawString("Hello World",20,20);
            }
}

put it in a file called HelloWorldApplet.java

Read full topic
item.source: So, how do I use my HelloWorldApp on a webpage?

item.title: So, how do I use my HelloWorldApp on a webpage?
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

Okay, JAVA is unlike the languages I know, since it’s all program - related and requires compiling and such. I went through the tutorial of the “Hello World” thing, it compiled right, but now how do I make a java applet say “Hello World” on a web page with what I did?

class HelloWorldApp {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello World!");
    }
}
<applet width="512" height="344" code="HelloWorldApp.class"></applet>
load: HelloWorldApp.class is not public or has no public constructor.
java.lang.IllegalAccessException: Class sun.applet.AppletPanel can not access a member of class HelloWorldApp with modifiers ""
	at sun.reflect.Reflection.ensureMemberAccess(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin.AppletViewer.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.runLoader(Unknown Source)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

I did a lil bit of research to see if anyone else had my problem on the Java website for beginners, and some guy said something about "extends java.applet.Applet ".

Can anybody give me a copy and pasteable of an applet saying hello world that will properly compile so this doesn’t become the biggest battle on getting started with Java Applets?

Thanks.

Read full topic
